description.narrative: By 2020, children, including those with disabilities, are prevented from school dropout.

mailing-address.narrative: UNICEF Armenia UN Building 14 Petros Adamyan Street Yerevan 0010 Armenia

sector.narrative: Education Management Information System (EMIS) (excluding learning assessment systems)
Relief co-ordination, protection and support services

title.narrative: UNICEF Programmes in Armenia (Social Protection and Child Poverty)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2017 Armenia: Final Evaluation of Mitigating Social Consequences of the Labour Migration and Maximising the Migrants’ Involvement in Local Development Project
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, children, including those with disabilities, are prevented from school dropout.

description.narrative: UNICEF facilitated negotiations between the Ministry of Labour and Social Affairs (MoLSA) and the Ministry of Education, Science, Culture and Sports (MoESCS) on monitoring education participation to ensure equity in access and learning. Due to the ongoing child care and inclusive education reforms, agreement on the monitoring of education participation of children with disabilities was prioritized, and disability indicators were added to the Education Management Information System (EMIS) and the development of a module on Special Education Needs Assessment was initiated. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:19/01/2020

title.narrative: Data and information on OOSC is shared between municipal, district and central level.

target.value: 2020:There is exchange and use of data and information on OOSC between municipal, district and central levels

title.narrative: The mechanism for identification of out-of-school children (OOSC) and referral back to school is in place and applied.

target.value: 2020:Mechanism for identification and referral of OOSC is endorsed and piloted

actual.value: 2019:EMIS includes Early Warning system, however due to vague roles and responsibilities of the government entities the case management is and follow up is fragmented.

title.narrative: System Strengthening - EMIS - Existence of school-based or district-based Early Warning System for children at risk of dropping out - score (1-4), see guidance

baseline.value: TOR on Early Warning System on EMIS is drafted

target.value: 2020:Early Warning System piloted in one district
